author: Brian R. Ball
title: FIRST LOOK: Dual-branded Marriott, Residence Inn replacing University Plaza by OSU
text:
5 photos Continental Real Estate and Concord Hospitality Enterprises are building a dual-branded… more Construction has begun on two linked hotels on the site of the former University Plaza Hotel and Conference Center near the Ohio State University campus. Site preparation and demolition work began in June at the 3110 Olentangy River Road site for a 240-room full-service Marriott Hotel and a 114-room Residence Inn being developed by Columbus-based Continental Real Estate Cos. and Concord Hospitality Enterprises Co. of North Carolina. The dual-branded property, a first for the Marriott chain , is expected to be ready late next year. The project cost is about $50 million. Continental President David Kass told me the Olentangy River Road lodging market has lacked a branded, full-service hotel. He cited expansions of OSU’s Wexner Medical Center and Riverside Methodist Hospital as supporting the need for the Residence Inn, the extended-stay brand of the Marriott International family of hotels that will offer travelers a mix of studio, one- and two-bedroom suites. The Marriott will offer 12,000 square feet of meeting space and the hotels will share some amenities including a pool, 2,000-square-foot fitness center and exterior courtyards. “This (lodging) corridor is getting very strong,” he said. Kass said the back guest-room portion of the shuttered University Plaza will get built into the Marriott. “It’s getting gutted and renovated,” he said. Concord and Continental bought the property a year ago from a joint venture of Columbus developers Indus Hotels and Core Real Estate Capital, which had planned a full-service Marriott on the site but failed to secure financing. Continental and Concord received a city environmental grant in support of the site redevelopment effort in May.
